com.st.st25sdk.command

Class Iso14443aCommand

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.st.st25sdk.command.Iso14443aCommand
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iso14443aCommandInterface

    public class Iso14443aCommand
extends java.lang.Object
implements Iso14443aCommandInterface
    Defines methods to build Iso44443-3 and Iso44443-4 commands

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Iso14443aCommand.iso14443aFrameMode
      Lists all possible Frames iso14443A

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_ANTICOLLISION1
      ISO14443-3 ANTICOLLISION cascade 1 command code
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_ANTICOLLISION2
      ISO14443-3 ANTICOLLISION cascade 2 command code
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_ANTICOLLISION3
      ISO14443-3 ANTICOLLISION cascade 3 command code
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_DESELECT
      Type4A deselect command code (needed for Anticollision to release tags from NFC type4 world)
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_HLTA
      ISO14443-3 hltA command code
      static byte ISO14443A_CMD_PPS
      ISO14443-4 PPS command code

      ISO14443-4 RATS command code

      ISO14443-3 reqA command code

      ISO14443-3 SELECT cascade 2 command code

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      byte[] anticollision1()
      Anticollision Level1 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x93, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 1.
      byte[] anticollision2()
      Anticollision Level2 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x95, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 2.
      byte[] anticollision3()
      Anticollision Level3 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x97, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 3.
      byte[] deselect()
      Function allowing to deselect.
      void hltA()
      Hlta command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send the Hlta command (command code 0x50)
      byte[] iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid)
      ISO14443A select tag procedure using wupA and select commands for iso14443-A and type2 tags
      byte[] iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid, byte ratsParam)
      ISO14443A select tag procedure using wupA, select and rats commands for type4A tags
      byte[] iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid, byte ratsParam, byte cidPpsParam, byte[] ppsParams)
      ISO14443A select tag procedure using wupA, select, rats and pps commands for type4A tags
      byte[] pps(byte cid, byte[] ppsParams)
      Pps command as defined in iso14443-4 specification Send the PPS command (Start byte + Param0 + Param1 (optional))
      byte[] rats(byte param)
      Rats command as defined in iso14443-4 specification Send the RATS command (0xE0 + param)
      byte[] rats(byte fsdi, byte cid)
      Rats command as defined in iso14443-4 specification Send the RATS command (0xE0 + data)
      byte[] reqA()
      ReqA command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send the ReqA command (command code 0x26)
      byte[] select1(byte[] data)
      Select Level1 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an SELECT command with a Select code of 0x93, the value of 0x70 for NVB (number of valid bits) and data containing valid UID bytes
      byte[] select2(byte[] data)
      Select Level2 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an SELECT command with a Select code of 0x95, the value of 0x70 for NVB (number of valid bits) and data containing valid UID bytes
      byte[] select3(byte[] data)
      Select Level3 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an SELECT command with a Select code of 0x97, the value of 0x70 for NVB (number of valid bits) and data containing valid UID bytes
      byte[] wupA()
      Wupa command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send the Wupa command (command code 0x52)

        public byte[] rats(byte fsdi,
                   byte cid)
            throws STException
        Description copied from interface: Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Rats command as defined in iso14443-4 specification Send the RATS command (0xE0 + data)
        Specified by:
        rats in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        fsdi - : 4bits defining the maximum size of a frame the tag can receive
        cid - : 4bits defining the logical number of the addressed tag
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • rats

        public byte[] rats(byte param)
            throws STException
        Description copied from interface: Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Rats command as defined in iso14443-4 specification Send the RATS command (0xE0 + param)
        Specified by:
        rats in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        param - 1 byte with b[8:5] = fsdi (4bits defining the maximum size of a frame the tag can receive) b[4:1] = cid (4bits defining the logical number of the addressed tag)
        Returns:
        tag's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • anticollision1

        public byte[] anticollision1()
                      throws STException
        Description copied from interface: Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Anticollision Level1 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x93, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 1. The value of 0x20 for NVB (number of valid bits) means that the reader is not sending any portion of the cascade level 1 UID. Each card within range of the terminal thus responds with its full cascade level 1 UID.
        Specified by:
        anticollision1 in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Returns:
        command's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • anticollision2

        public byte[] anticollision2()
                      throws STException
        Description copied from interface: Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Anticollision Level2 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x95, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 2. The value of 0x20 for NVB (number of valid bits) means that the reader is not sending any portion of the cascade level 2 UID. Each card within range of the terminal thus responds with its full cascade level 2 UID.
        Specified by:
        anticollision2 in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Returns:
        command's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • anticollision3

        public byte[] anticollision3()
                      throws STException
        Description copied from interface: Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Anticollision Level3 command as defined in iso14443-3 specification Send an ANTICOLLISION command with a Select code of 0x97, which indicates an anticollision frame for cascade level 3. The value of 0x20 for NVB (number of valid bits) means that the reader is not sending any portion of the cascade level 2 UID. Each card within range of the terminal thus responds with its full cascade level 3 UID.
        Specified by:
        anticollision3 in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Returns:
        command's response
        Throws:
        STException

      • iso14443aSelectTag

        public byte[] iso14443aSelectTag(byte[] uid,
                                 byte ratsParam,
                                 byte cidPpsParam,
                                 byte[] ppsParams)
                          throws STException
        ISO14443A select tag procedure using wupA, select, rats and pps commands for type4A tags
        Specified by:
        iso14443aSelectTag in interface Iso14443aCommandInterface
        Parameters:
        uid - tag's uid to be selected
        ratsParam - byte containing FSDI and CID value for rats command
        cidPpsParam - cid parameter for pps command
        ppsParams - pps parameters
        Returns:
        tag's response to pps (1 byte) and rats command
        Throws:
        STException
